results.title: The Dounreay project
results.creator_credit: Ace Films, UK Atomic Energy Authority and Frank Green
results.brief_description: This film shows the construction of the Dounreay Reactor. From redesigning the coastline and big tunnels beneath the ocean to cement monoliths with steel plating. We see every part of Dounreay being built and clearly explained. A product of knowledge and proudness in its day - and sadly to become one day dangerous and obsolete.

results.title: The Double life of Veronique = La Double vie de Veronique
results.creator_credit: Sideral Productions, Studio Canal+, Leonardo De La Fuerite and Krzysztof Kieslowski
results.brief_description: Two girls are born on the same day - one in Poland, the other in France. 25 years later they share the same looks, name and a great musical talent. They also share a potentially fatal heart disease. Though they live a world apart, Veronique and Veronika, (both played by Irene Jacob) are deeply linked in a way that defies explanation. In a mystical twist of fate, these two women will meet in a crowded city square and set in motion a series of dramatic events, ensuring that one must die so that the other can live. French and Polish dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Double helix
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films, EFVA and Peter De Normanville
results.brief_description: Part of the Nobel Laureates series. Shows the work of several scientists in determining the structure of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA). Uses animated diagrams to illustrate the structure of DNA. Discusses the significance of DNA in all living organisms. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Double headed eagle: Hitler's rise to power 1918-1933
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, BFI, Sandy Lieberson, David Puttnam and Lutz Becker
results.brief_description: This extraordinary documentary charts the rise to power of Hitler and the Nazis, through the chaos of the Weimar republic. Rather than using voice-over narration the film relies on newsreels, home movie footage, and extracts from musicals and documentaries of the period to describe the state of German society during turbulent times. In doing so it reveals the disintegration of the old Germany and the advancement of the new, as represented by young Adolf Hitler and his peers. The film is broken into chapters, each dedicated to a different year during this period. Written by Lutz Becker and Philippe Mora. In German with English subtitles and captions.

results.title: The Double-spandrel bridge
results.brief_description: China has a long history in bridge building, but the cross curved arch bridge or the “double spandrel bridge” is a new breakthrough in the history of China’s bridge construction. Easy, quick and inexpensive to build, and full of national characteristics, it economises on materials and facilitates transport and communications. Shows the development and construction of some of China’s 1,200 double spandrel bridges. In English with Chinese and English subtitles.

results.title: The Double-decked 'strato' clipper
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Designed to acquaint the public with the facilities provided for speedy and comfortable air travel by modern airliners, this film observes the operation of a Boeing double-decked airliner, the “Strato-cruiser”. Includes also an account of the development of trans-oceanic air travel and of the Boeing/Pan Am aircraft, pre and post WWII.

results.title: The Doors: dance on fire
results.brief_description: The Doors, and in particular their lead singer Jim Morrison, were the Dionysian soundtrack to the counter-cultural storms of the late sixties. This video features live performances, television appearances, interviews and original filmclips of the band including their controversial rendition of “Light My Fire” on the Ed Sullivan Show. Other songs featured include “People Are Strange”, “L.A. Woman”, “Roadhouse Blues”, “The End”, “Riders on a Storm” and the original “Unknown Soldier” filmclip banned in 1968.

results.title: The Door
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jo-Anne McGowan and Josie Keys
results.brief_description: The removal of a teenager’s bedroom door by her frugal step father (he has insisted the family live on weet-bix for the last three years) is emblematic of family tension in this telling film about the perils of adolescent years, and the lack of communication within the family unit. Cast includes Barry Otto, Penne Hackforth-Jones and Inge Hornstra.
